content.question: Consecutive terms of a sequence have the values <math alttext="2"><semantics><mn>2</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="negative 1"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="1 half"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="negative 1 fourth"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="1 over 8"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Of the following, which describes the sequence?

choices.label: ​​The terms could be part of a geometric sequence with a common ratio of <math alttext="negative 2"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​The terms could be part of a geometric sequence with a common ratio of <math alttext="negative 1 half"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​The terms could be part of a geometric sequence with a common ratio of <math alttext="1 half"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.
The terms are part of a sequence other than a geometric sequence because the common ratio of a geometric sequence must be positive.

content.answer: ​The terms could be part of a geometric sequence with a common ratio of <math alttext="negative 1 half"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.
